channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: CPAN great modules released last week
Exploiting Perl 6 Code From Down The Dependency Chain
item.description: Half the battle is knowing thyne enemie's dirty tricks. Here, how malicious dependencies (or dependencies of our dependencies) could unleash evil to our codebase is explored.

item.title: A Quick One From Orlando
item.description: An overview of what is happening in the world of Perl6.

item.title: Easy OAuth Integration with Runkeeper and Spotify
item.description: Nice new Mojolicious plugin to make the oauth dance a wee bit less painful.

item.title: Why do I like simple object system? Object::Simple story.
item.description: If you like Mojolicious's Mojo::Base and would wish to use it in non-Mojorelated projects, rejoice, for Object::Simple has entered the OO arena, and draws heavy, heeeavy inspiration from the Mojolicious code.

item.title: Personal Programming Plans: Instagram2Background
item.description: Handy utility script to set your latest Instagram picture as your desktop background.

item.title: Cool Perl 6 features available in Perl 5
item.description: Cross-pollinisation is a wonderful thing. Like some of them cool features in Perl6, but not ready to take the leap into a whole new language? No worry: some of them trinkled back down into Perl5-land.

item.title: An improved Perl API for cme and Config::Model
item.description: Managing configuration files just got a little easier.

item.title: By the Numbers - YAPC::NA::2016 - Wednesday Night Pull Request Challenge
item.description: The CPAN Pull Request Challenge has spilled into Conference Space, with pleasing results. And if you missed that one, never fear: another PRC hacking session is planned for YAPC::EU.

item.title: Thinking of giving your first ever Perl talk?
item.description: Then you might want to watch the YAPC videos for inspiration and lessons in things to do (or avoid).

item.title: A Date with CPAN, Part 11: Sweet Release
item.description: Curious about the work that goes behind releasing code on CPAN, or curious about this latest Date/Time module? This article's for you.

item.title: Perl 5 Porters Mailing List Summary: June 16th-21st
item.description: You would think the P5Porters would take a break during CPAN week. But nope, they just keep rollin'.

item.title: Comprehensive guide and tools to split monolithic database into shards using Perl
item.description: An excellent guide to that dreaded moment in every dev's life when a database has finally reached a size where it's too unwiedly for a single instance and the big guns have to be drawn out.

item.title: #257 - The Conference is Gone, but the Videos Remain
item.description: YAPC::NA is over, but the organizers have been incredibly diligent and most (if not all) of the conference videos are now available for download. I don't know about you, but as far as I'm concerned, there might be some YouTube binge-watching in my near future... Enjoy! ~ `/anick
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
